1.text: “My spirit is broken; my days are extinguished; the grave awaits me.

2.text: Surely mockers surround me, and my eyes must gaze at their rebellion.

3.text: Give me, I pray, the pledge You demand. Who else will be my guarantor?

4.text: You have closed their minds to understanding; therefore You will not exalt them.

5.text: If a man denounces his friends for a price, the eyes of his children will fail.

6.text: He has made me a byword among the people, a man in whose face they spit.

7.text: My eyes have grown dim with grief, and my whole body is but a shadow.

8.text: The upright are appalled at this, and the innocent are stirred against the godless.

9.text: Yet a righteous one holds to his way, and the one with clean hands grows stronger.

10.text: But come back and try again, all of you. For I will not find a wise man among you.

11.text: My days have passed; my plans are broken off—even the desires of my heart.

12.text: They have turned night into day, making light seem near in the face of darkness.

13.text: If I look for Sheol as my home, if I spread out my bed in darkness,

14.text: and say to corruption, ‘You are my father,’ and to the worm, ‘My mother,’ or ‘My sister,’

15.text: where then is my hope? Who can see any hope for me?

16.text: Will it go down to the gates of Sheol? Will we go down together into the dust?”
